# UD Classical Chinese TueCL

Language: [Classical Chinese](/lzh/index.html) (code: `lzh`)<br/>
Family: Sino-Tibetan

This treebank has been part of Universal Dependencies since the UD v2.14 release.

The following people have contributed to making this treebank part of UD: Yifei Chen, John Wang, Çağrı Çöltekin.

Repository: [UD_Classical_Chinese-TueCL](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Classical_Chinese-TueCL)<br />
Search this treebank on-line: [PML-TQ](https://lindat.mff.cuni.cz/services/pmltq/#!/treebank/udlzh_tuecl214)<br />
Download all treebanks: [UD 2.14](/#download)

License: CC BY-SA 4.0

Genre: fiction

Questions, comments?
General annotation questions (either Classical Chinese-specific or cross-linguistic) can be raised in the [main UD issue tracker](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/docs/issues).
You can report bugs in this treebank in the [treebank-specific issue tracker on Github](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Classical_Chinese-TueCL/issues).
If you want to collaborate, please contact [yifei&nbsp;•&nbsp;chen&nbsp;(æt)&nbsp;student&nbsp;•&nbsp;uni-tuebingen&nbsp;•&nbsp;de,johnz&nbsp;•&nbsp;wang&nbsp;(æt)&nbsp;outlook&nbsp;•&nbsp;com,cagri&nbsp;•&nbsp;coeltekin&nbsp;(æt)&nbsp;uni-tuebingen&nbsp;•&nbsp;de].
Development of the treebank happens directly in the UD repository, so you may submit bug fixes as pull requests against the dev branch.

| Relations | annotated manually, natively in UD style |

## Description

A dependency Treebank of "逍遥游(Enjoyment in Untroubled Ease)" written by Zhuangzi.



Full text of the source is available at:
<https://chinesenotes.com/zhuangzi/zhuangzi001.html> (in both EN&CN),
and translation to modern Chinese is available at <https://so.gushiwen.cn/shiwenv_5bfecbe60620.aspx>
(or <http://www.acmuller.net/con-dao/zhuangzi.html>).

<h2>Tokenization and Word Segmentation</h2>


<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 100 sentences and 648 tokens.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 648 tokens (100%) that are not followed by a space.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not contain words with spaces.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not contain words that contain both letters and punctuation.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
</ul>

<h2>Morphology</h2>

<h3>Tags</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 13 UPOS tags out of 17 possible: <a>ADJ</a>, <a>ADP</a>, <a>ADV</a>, <a>AUX</a>, <a>CCONJ</a>, <a>DET</a>, <a>NOUN</a>, <a>NUM</a>, <a>PART</a>, <a>PRON</a>, <a>PROPN</a>, <a>SCONJ</a>, <a>VERB</a></li>
<li>This corpus does not use the following tags: INTJ, SYM, PUNCT, X</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 12 word types tagged as particles (PART): 乎, 也, 哉, 夫, 已, 所, 焉, 然, 矣, 者, 而, 邪</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 13 lemmas tagged as pronouns (PRON): _, 之, 其, 奚, 己, 彼, 惡, 我, 斯, 是, 此, 焉, 自</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 2 lemmas tagged as determiners (DET): 之, 數</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>Out of the above, 1 lemmas occurred sometimes as PRON and sometimes as DET: 之</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 1 lemmas tagged as auxiliaries (AUX): 爲</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>Out of the above, 1 lemmas occurred sometimes as AUX and sometimes as VERB: 爲</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not use the VerbForm feature.</li>
</ul>

<h2>Syntax</h2>

<h3>Auxiliary Verbs and Copula</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 1 lemmas as copulas (<a>cop</a>). Examples: 爲.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not contain auxiliaries.</li>
</ul>

<h3>Core Arguments, Oblique Arguments and Adjuncts</h3>

Here we consider only relations between verbs (parent) and nouns or pronouns (child).

<h3>Verbs with Reflexive Core Objects</h3>

<ul>
  <li>This corpus contains 2 lemmas that occur at least once with a reflexive core object (<a>obj</a> or <a>iobj</a>). Examples: 無 己、 視 自</li>
</ul>

<h3>Relations Overview</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 4 relation subtypes: <a>discourse:sp</a>, <a>flat:vv</a>, <a>obl:lmod</a>, <a>obl:tmod</a></li>
<li>The following 11 relation types are not used in this corpus at all: <a>xcomp</a>, <a>vocative</a>, <a>expl</a>, <a>aux</a>, <a>appos</a>, <a>list</a>, <a>orphan</a>, <a>goeswith</a>, <a>reparandum</a>, <a>punct</a>, <a>dep</a></li>
</ul>
